item.title: Solar storms cause GPS in tractors to temporarily break during height of planting season
item.description: Many tractors use GPS to plant precise rows to avoid gaps and overlap. Farmers rely on it to plant more efficiently and precisely.

item.title: U.S. recovering from pandemic learning loss, but gaps remain
item.description: American students are starting to recover from pandemic learning losses, according to a Harvard University study. But test scores still lag behind 2019 levels, and schools will soon run out of federal pandemic-era funding. CBS News reporter Taurean Small examines how different states are addressing challenges in the classroom and on the balance books.

item.title: U.S. honey bee population reaches record high
item.description: In 2006, bees across the U.S. started dying rapidly. Now, the U.S. honey bee population is at an all-time high, according to the Census of Agriculture. Clay Bolt, manager of pollinator conservation for the World Wildlife Fund U.S., joins CBS News to explain what happened.

item.title: CDC to publicly post wastewater data amid bird flu outbreak
item.description: As bird flu spreads among cows in the U.S., the CDC plans to publicly post data on a specific influenza virus found in wastewater. Dr. Celine Gounder, CBS News medical contributor and editor-at-large for public health at KFF, joins to break down the latest developments in tracking the virus.

item.title: Why are GameStop shares on the rise again?
item.description: The stock for video game retailer GameStop closed up 74% on Monday, harkening back to the buying frenzy in January 2021 fueled by traders on Reddit. Martin Baccardax, senior editor and chief markets correspondent for TheStreet, joins CBS News to examine what could be behind the stock's sudden surge.

item.title: Breaking down the charges against Sen. Bob Menendez
item.description: Gold bars, foreign entities and a new Mercedes-Benz are just some elements in the federal corruption trial of New Jersey Democratic Sen. Bob Menendez, which saw the start of jury selection on Monday. CBS News congressional correspondent Scott MacFarlane explains.

item.title: Crews demolish Key Bridge section to free cargo ship
item.description: Crews in Baltimore conducted a controlled demolition Monday of what remains of the collapsed Francis Scott Key Bridge. Officials say the demolition will help free the cargo ship that crashed into the bridge in March. CBS News Baltimore investigative reporter Mike Hellgren explains what happens next.

item.title: Takeaways from Michael Cohen's 1st day on the stand in Trump trial
item.description: Donald Trump's former lawyer and self-described "fixer" Michael Cohen took the stand Monday in the former president's criminal "hush money" trial. CBS News legal analyst Rikki Klieman, who was in the courtroom, joins to break down the testimony.

item.title: U.S., Israel relationship gets tense over Rafah approach
item.description: The U.S. is still pressing Israel over its planned ground operation in Gaza's southern city of Rafah. CBS News senior White House correspondent Weijia Jiang breaks down how conversations are evolving.

item.title: Biden to announce new 100% tariffs on EVs
item.description: The tariff on electric vehicles from China is currently 25%.

item.title: Memorial Day weekend 2024 could be busiest for travel in nearly 20 years
item.description: AAA is expecting a nearly 5% bump in airline travel and a 4% increase in drivers this Memorial Day weekend.

item.title: FAFSA glitches affecting college-bound students
item.description: The forms to apply for financial aid were released three months late this year, and one estimate shows over 25% of schools still haven't sent out aid packages.

item.title: Therapy dogs bring joy to government workers in Washington, D.C.
item.description: Four-legged friends are doing their part to bring smiles to government workers in Washington, D.C. The therapy dogs visited Capitol Hill, the State Department and USAID. CBS News' Natalie Brand tagged along for one of the canine visits.

item.title: FAFSA glitches leave many high school seniors in limbo
item.description: Nearly two weeks after what is traditionally "College Decision Day," many students are still unable to commit to a school. That's largely because of computer glitches in the Department of Education's newly overhauled financial aid system. Meg Oliver has details.

item.title: Parishioners at Louisiana church stop possible mass shooting
item.description: A 16-year-old boy carrying a gun opened the back door of a packed church, but was immediately confronted by and escorted away by parishioners.

item.title: White House urges Israel to do more to protect civilians in Gaza
item.description: Israeli forces have pushed across the southern part of Gaza in what the military says are limited and precise attacks targeting Hamas militants. Jake Sullivan, national security adviser to President Biden, called on Israel to do more to protect civilians. CBS News chief White House correspondent Nancy Cordes reports.

item.title: The best prescription sunglasses for 2024
item.description: If you already have a valid eyeglass prescription, save money by shopping for prescription sunglasses online.

item.title: New poll finds Trump leading Biden in 5 battleground states
item.description: New polling from The New York Times suggests former President Donald Trump's "hush money" trial isn't hurting him in key battleground states. Washington Post national politics reporter Sabrina Rodriguez and Politico national political correspondent Brakkton Booker join "America Decides" with analysis.

item.title: How conductor Xian Zhang is breaking barriers
item.description: In celebration of Asian American and Pacific Islander heritage month, Nancy Chen has the story of an inspiring maestro who's breaking barriers while hitting all the right notes.

item.title: Best strollers for babies and toddlers in 2024
item.description: Spoil yourself and your baby with a smooth ride stroller that collapses easily and stores baby's precious cargo.

item.title: What to know about Sen. Menendez's corruption case as jury selection begins
item.description: Jury selection began Monday in the corruption trial of Sen. Bob Menendez. The New Jersey Democrat is accused of taking bribes from three businessmen in the form of cash, gold bars and a Mercedes-Benz in exchange for political favors. CBS News congressional correspondent Scott MacFarlane has the latest.

item.title: Louisiana church thwarts mass shooting at service packed with kids
item.description: A quick-thinking church congregation worked together to prevent a mass shooting in Louisiana over the weekend. The church was packed with dozens of kids about to take part in a sacred rite of passage. Omar Villafranca reports.

item.title: Trump campaigns in deep-blue New Jersey
item.description: Former President Donald Trump took a break from the courtroom Saturday to rally supporters at the Jersey Shore. CBS News' Olivia Rinaldi and Fin Gómez have more on the campaign stop.

item.title: Record travel expected as millions make plans for Memorial Day
item.description: Tens of millions of Americans are gearing up for the upcoming Memorial Day weekend. Nearly 50 million people are expected to travel 50 miles or more this year, making it the busiest Memorial Day weekend in almost 20 years, according to AAA. Kris Van Cleave has more.

item.title: New York City grapples with spate of random attacks
item.description: Residents in New York City are on edge following a string of unprovoked attacks, including two high-profile incidents in the last week. A tourist in Times Square was stabbed over Mother's Day weekend while an award-winning actor was punched in the face by a stranger just days earlier. Nikki Battiste reports on what the NYPD is doing to keep the Big Apple safe.

item.title: Michael Cohen, key witness against Trump, testifies about "hush money" payments
item.description: On the stand, Michael Cohen told jurors about the decade he spent working for Trump as his self-described "fixer" and attorney.

item.title: Crews conduct controlled demolition of Baltimore's Key Bridge
item.description: Engineers set off controlled explosions in the wreckage of the Francis Scott Key Bridge on Monday to help free the massive cargo ship that crashed into it nearly seven weeks ago. Nicole Sganga has the sights and sounds.

item.title: Fighting continues in Gaza amid worsening struggle to find food and shelter
item.description: Israel is again fighting Hamas in northern Gaza months after saying the militants had been largely removed from that area. The fighting continued in southern Gaza as well, worsening the struggle to find food and shelter for hundreds of thousands of displaced Palestinians. Ramy Inocencio reports.

item.title: Michael Cohen testifies about Stormy Daniels payment at Donald Trump's criminal trial
item.description: Donald Trump came face-to-face with his former personal attorney Michael Cohen, who testified Monday in the former president's New York criminal trial. The one-time fixer and inside man detailed how Trump personally approved the so-called "hush money" payouts to hide stories he believed would hurt his 2016 run for the White House. Robert Costa was inside the courthouse for the riveting testimony.

item.title: "CBS Evening News" headlines for Monday, May 13, 2024
item.description: Here's a look at the top stories making headlines on the "CBS Evening News with Norah O'Donnell."
